alert.note: Alert for Montgomery; Robertson (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 29 at 1:06PM CDT until June 29 at 4:15PM CDT by NWS Nashville
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 415 PM CDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of Middle Tennessee, including the following counties, Montgomery and Robertson. * WHEN...Until 415 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 103 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. - This includes the following streams and drainages... Calebs Creek including Coopertown and Flewellyn, Sulphur Fork Creek including Greenbrier and Springfield, Spring Creek including Kinneys, and Millers Creek including Sandy Springs and Turnersville. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Springfield, Greenbrier, Coopertown, Pleasant View, Adams and Cedar Hill. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
